criterion: Reward for accurately capturing the clinician’s stated assessment of a sinus infection, the exact prescription of penicillin for 10 days, and the patient’s agreement to start tonight.

Reward for incorporating all relevant chart details verbatim or near-verbatim (e.g., severe penicillin allergy, demographics, current hypertension) while omitting chart elements that are not pertinent to this encounter.
Penalize for any omission or distortion of major encounter elements spoken in the transcript, such as assessment, medication name, duration, or patient response, resulting in an incomplete note.
Penalize for introducing information not grounded in the transcript or chart (new diagnoses, dosages, instructions, test results, reasoning, etc.).
Penalize for inaccurate or selective copying of chart data, including misstated allergy details, demographic errors, or inclusion of irrelevant chart sections.
